recalls.Summary: Honda (American Honda Motor Co.) is recalling certain 2017 Acura NSX vehicles.  Road vibrations may cause the metal screws that secure the printed circuit board for the high mounted center brake light to loosen and contact the circuitry, possibly resulting in the brake light fuse blowing and the brake lights not functioning.  As such, these vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard (FMVSS) number 108, "Lamps, Reflective Devices, and Associated Equipment."
recalls.Consequence: Brake lights that do not work increase the risk of a crash.
recalls.Remedy: Honda will notify owners, and dealers will replace the center high mount brake light, free of charge.  The recall began November 2, 2018.  Owners may contact Acura Client Relations at 1-844-682-2872.  Honda's number for this recall is B2B.
recalls.Notes: Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.

recalls.Summary: Honda (American Honda Motor Co.) is recalling certain 2017-2018 Acura NSX vehicles.  The crossover pipe couplers between the left and right fuel tanks may leak.
recalls.Consequence: A fuel leak in the presence of an ignition source can increase the risk of a fire.
recalls.Remedy: Honda will notify owners, and dealers will replace the left and right fuel tanks, free of charge.  The recall began February 12, 2019.  Owners may contact Honda customer service at 1-888-234-2138.  Honda's numbers for this recall are U29, and Z28.
recalls.Notes: Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.

recalls.Summary: Honda (American Honda Motor Co.) is recalling certain 2013-2023 Honda Accord, Civic Coupe, Civic Sedan, Civic Hatchback, Civic Type R, CR-V, HR-V, Ridgeline, Odyssey, Acura ILX, MDX, MDX Hybrid, RDX, RLX, TLX, 2019-2022 Honda Insight, Passport, 2020 Honda CR-V Hybrid, 2018-2019 Honda Clarity PHEV, Fit, and 2015-2020 Honda Accord Hybrid, Pilot, Acura NSX vehicles.  The fuel pump inside the fuel tank may fail.
recalls.Consequence: Fuel pump failure can cause an engine stall while driving, increasing the risk of a crash.
recalls.Remedy: Dealers will replace the fuel pump module, free of charge.  Owner letters were mailed September 6, 2024.  Owners may contact Honda customer service at 1-888-234-2138.  Honda's numbers for this recall are KGC and KGD.  This recall is an expansion of NHTSA recall numbers 21V-215 and 20V-314.
recalls.Notes: Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.nhtsa.gov.

complaints.summary: On my 2017 Acura NSX, Fuel Pump Module have failed on July 12, 2025, while driving on a highway, and the engine stalled coming to a stop in the middle of the freeway. The service dealer at Greensboro Acura confirmed the failed Fuel Pump Module part number is 17708-T6N-A02-M1 and it is clearly listed under NHTSA Recall 23V-858 report on page 11 Component Name 31.  I have reported this incident and explained to Honda/Acura Client Relations Recall division, but was told that there's NO recall on my VIN. I believe Honda/Acura has failed to include this vehicle's VIN as part of the NHTSA Recall 23V-858 clearly includes recall information of the part listed on page 11 of NHTSA Recall 23V-858 report - Component Name 31.  I have included a picture of the part 17708-T6N-A02-M1. I believe Acura/Honda has failed to add my VIN as part of the recall. Now that it has failed and require replacement, I hope you attend to this urgent matter at your earliest convenient time possible.

My vehicle is 2017 Acura NSX with VIN 19UNC1B08HY000777. My vehicle experienced a fuel pump module failure identical to the known defect under Recall 23V-858, but my VIN is not currently included in the recall. I believe it should be. This is a significant safety matter, as I faced such fuel pump module failure that caused failure of the overall vehicle that came to a stop while I was driving on a freeway. I've never experienced such unsafe events. The car is not drivable and failed in hazardous conditions and is a safety risk. It was towed to the Acura dealer and diagnosed with Fuel Pump Malfunction with DTC P0087 and P2636 identical to known defect under Recall 23V-858. Please review and consider adding my VIN to Recall 23V-858.

THE CAR HAS LOST POWER A COUPLE OF TIMES.  WHEN THE CAR'S BATTERY GOES DEAD, YOU CANNOT CLOSE EITHER DOOR ON THIS CAR.  IF YOU HAVE BAD WEATHER THERE IS A GOOD CHANCE THE INTERIOR OF THIS CAR WILL GET DAMAGED.  THERE IS AN ONE INCH GAP BETWEEN THE DOOR AND THE BODY OF THE CAR.  THE DOORS WILL LOCK UP AND YOU CANNOT DO ANYTHING UNTIL POWER IS RESTORED.  IN CASE OF EMERGENCY YOU CANNOT LOCK YOURSELF IN THE CAR AND THERE AGAIN YOU CANNOT SECURE THE VECHICLE IF NEEDING TO GO FOR HELP.  THERE IS ALSO A RATTLE IN BOTH DOORS.  THE DEALERSHIP HAS HAD THE CAR FOR OVER 40 DAYS IN THE FIRST YEAR.
CARBON FIBER BRAKE ROTORS ARE CRACKING AND ACURA S DOING NOTHING TO CORRECT THE PROBLEM
EVERY TIME YOU ACCELERATE IT MAKES A LOAD RATTLING NOISE & THE A.C.  WORKS WHEN IT WANTS TO ..

serviceIntervals.service_description: Replace engine oil and filter for hybrid system
serviceIntervals.skip_consequences: Engine wear, hybrid system damage, void warranty

serviceIntervals.service_description: Replace dual-clutch transmission fluid and filter
Replace engine and hybrid cooling system fluid

serviceIntervals.skip_consequences: Misfires, reduced fuel economy, rough idle
Poor air quality, reduced HVAC efficiency
Uneven tire wear, reduced tire life

serviceIntervals.service_description: Inspect brake pads, rotors, and system components
Comprehensive vehicle inspection including hybrid systems
Test and service 12V and hybrid batteries

tuning.engine_family: 3.5L Twin-Turbo V6 + 3 Electric Motors (Sport Hybrid SH-AWD)

tuning_platforms.name: Hondata FlashPro
tuning_platforms.notes: Limited support, mainly for hybrid system optimization

tuning_platforms.name: ScienceofSpeed Custom ECU
tuning_platforms.notes: Full standalone solution with hybrid integration

stage_progressions.notes: ECU tune with basic bolt-ons, limited by hybrid system integration complexity
Full exhaust system with upgraded intercoolers and advanced tuning
Major turbocharger upgrades with standalone management, very limited options

issues.title: Infotainment System Freezing and Black Screen
issues.description: The infotainment display randomly freezes, goes black, or becomes unresponsive. System may require hard reset or replacement of the head unit.
issues.fix_description: Software update or complete head unit replacement
issues.prevention: Avoid extreme temperature exposure, perform regular software updates

issues.title: Carbon Fiber Body Panel Delamination
issues.description: Carbon fiber body panels, particularly around door sills and rear panels, may show signs of delamination or clear coat peeling.
symptoms: Visible separation of carbon fiber layers
issues.prevention: Regular washing, avoid harsh chemicals, garage parking

issues.title: Brake System Noise and Judder
issues.description: Premature brake disc warping causing judder and noise during braking. Some owners report brake noise even with low mileage.
issues.fix_description: Brake disc and pad replacement, possible caliper service
issues.prevention: Proper brake cooling, avoid excessive hard braking

issues.title: Rear Spoiler Motor Failure
issues.description: The active rear spoiler may fail to deploy or retract properly due to motor or control module failure.
issues.fix_description: Spoiler motor replacement or control module repair
issues.prevention: Regular cleaning of spoiler mechanism, avoid manual manipulation

issues.title: Transmission Oil Cooler Line Leak
issues.description: Transmission oil cooler lines may develop leaks, particularly at connection points, leading to transmission fluid loss.
issues.fix_description: Replace transmission cooler lines and seals
issues.prevention: Regular transmission service, monitor fluid levels

issues.title: Door Handle Mechanism Failure
issues.description: Electronic door handles may become unresponsive or mechanically jam, preventing normal door operation.
issues.fix_description: Door handle mechanism replacement and reprogramming

issues.title: Climate Control Malfunction
issues.description: Air conditioning system may fail to cool properly or produce inconsistent temperatures, often related to electronic control issues.
issues.fix_description: AC system diagnosis, compressor or control module replacement
issues.prevention: Regular AC service, run system periodically

issues.title: Engine Mount Vibration Issues
issues.description: Premature engine mount wear causing excessive vibration in the cabin, particularly at idle or during acceleration.
issues.prevention: Avoid aggressive launch techniques, regular inspection

issues.title: Hybrid Battery Cooling System Issues
issues.description: The hybrid battery cooling system may develop leaks or pump failures, potentially leading to battery overheating and reduced performance.
issues.fix_description: Cooling system repair or battery cooling unit replacement
issues.prevention: Regular hybrid system maintenance, monitor warning lights

issues.title: Suspension Component Premature Wear
issues.description: Adaptive suspension components may wear prematurely, causing handling issues and potential safety concerns.
issues.prevention: Avoid rough roads, regular alignment checks

issues.title: Windshield Stress Cracking
issues.description: Windshields may develop stress cracks, particularly along the edges, even without impact damage.
issues.prevention: Avoid extreme temperature changes, careful washing

editorial.tagline: Japan's hybrid hypercar returns with electric fury
editorial.hero_blurb: The second-generation NSX proves that Honda's supercar legacy burns brighter than ever. This hybrid marvel delivers 573 horsepower through a sophisticated all-wheel-drive system that makes every corner a revelation.
editorial.essence: The NC1 NSX represents Honda's most advanced engineering achievement, combining a twin-turbo V6 with three electric motors for otherworldly performance. It's a thinking enthusiast's supercar that prioritizes precision and technology over raw brutality.
editorial.heritage: Born from Honda's 1990s NSX legacy, the NC1 spent nearly a decade in development as Honda's engineers reimagined what a modern supercar could be. This generation marked Honda's return to the supercar arena after the original NSX ended production in 2005.
editorial.design_philosophy: Honda's engineers pursued the philosophy of 'New Sports eXperience,' creating a hybrid supercar that enhances rather than replaces the driver. Every system was designed to amplify human capability while maintaining the pure connection that made the original NSX legendary.
editorial.motorsport_history: The NSX competed in IMSA and Pirelli World Challenge, with the GT3 version serving as a testbed for production car technologies. While not as decorated as its predecessor in motorsport, it proved Honda's continued commitment to performance development.
editorial.engine_character: The twin-turbo V6 delivers power with surgical precision, while the electric motors fill every gap with instant torque. The combination creates a uniquely smooth and relentless power delivery that builds to an intoxicating crescendo.
editorial.transmission_feel: The 9-speed dual-clutch transmission shifts with lightning precision, while the hybrid system's torque-fill eliminates any hint of lag. Paddle shifts are crisp and immediate, perfectly complementing the powertrain's technological sophistication.
editorial.chassis_dynamics: The Space Frame chassis offers incredible rigidity while the adaptive dampers and torque vectoring create a car that flows through corners with supernatural grace. It's clinical yet engaging, precise yet forgiving.
editorial.steering_feel: The electric power steering provides excellent feedback and perfect weighting, offering the kind of precision that inspires confidence at any speed. It's not as raw as the original NSX but maintains that essential Honda connection.
editorial.brake_confidence: Brembo brakes provide tremendous stopping power with excellent pedal feel, while the regenerative system blends seamlessly for consistent performance. The brakes inspire complete confidence even under extreme conditions.
editorial.sound_signature: The twin-turbo V6 produces a sophisticated growl that's more refined than raw, with the electric motors adding an otherworldly whir. It's a distinctly modern sound that's captivating without being overwhelming.
editorial.ideal_owner: Technology-appreciating enthusiasts who want supercar performance with daily usability and appreciate Honda's engineering excellence over badge prestige.
editorial.not_ideal_for: Traditional supercar buyers seeking maximum drama, pure V8/V10 soundtracks, or those prioritizing brand status over driving dynamics.
editorial.buyers_summary: The NC1 NSX offers incredible performance and Honda reliability in a package that's more accessible than its exotic competitors. Values have stabilized, making it an excellent entry point into hybrid supercar ownership.
cons: Limited emotional drama compared to rivals

fitment.clearance_notes: Factory fitment with no clearance issues
Factory optional fitment with no clearance issues
More sidewall for track use, may require slight camber adjustment
Larger diameter may reduce ride quality
fitment.known_issues: Limited tire selection, increased road noise

warnings.message: VERIFY: brembo brakes listed but Acura NSX NC1 may not come with brembo stock. This could be an aftermarket upgrade confused with OEM specs.
VERIFY: "6-piston" calipers are uncommon on stock vehicles. Most OEM brakes use 1-2 piston sliding calipers.
VERIFY: "4-piston brembo" calipers are uncommon on stock vehicles. Most OEM brakes use 1-2 piston sliding calipers.
